Basic details: Emily Carter, a 40-year-old female, comes to the clinic complaining of right calf pain.
Vitals:
BP: 130/80 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 18/minute
HR: 82/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sit on the examination table and occasionally rub your right calf.
Exhibit mild discomfort when asked to stand or walk.
If asked about recent activities, mention a long flight you took a few days ago.
If ultrasound is mentioned by the examinee, ask, “What is an ultrasound?”
Challenging question: "Could this be a blood clot? Should I be worried about a DVT?"
